name: Apple Website UI – Figma Speed Tutorial
description:
Take a sneak peek into one of my casual design sessions where I practice recreating Apple’s website UI in Figma.


Youtube Figma Tutorial: https://youtu.be/xbhFfzcYkXQ


WHAT I’VE LEARNED

- It’s useful to have a design library to access common styles (e.g. colors, buttons, font sizes).

- Use an 8pt grid system when spacing out items. It improves the clarity and presentation of information on a device or screen.

- When setting borders or lines, go for solid numbers instead of having decimals. Instead of setting a width to 1.14px, set it to 1px.

- Apple has a native typography called SF Pro. You can download it from their developers website. (https://developer.apple.com/fonts/)
